item.title: Overcoming Bias : We Moderns Are Status-Drunk
item.description: Twelve years ago I posted on how our era is a rare unique “dreamtime” of fast growth, wide cultural integration, and delusional beliefs. item.title: Temporal: getting started with JavaScript’s new date time API
item.description: Date, JavaScript’s current date time API is infamously difficult to use. The ECMAScript proposal “Temporal” is a new and better date time API and currently at stage 3. It was created by Philipp Dunkel, Maggie Johnson-Pint, Matt Johnson-Pint, Brian Terlson, Shane Carr, Ujjwal Sharma, Philip Chimento, Jason Williams, and Justin Grant.

item.title: Improving Angular CI Build Time Using Azure DevOps Cache task
item.description: This article will discuss about improving Angular CI build time using Azure DevOps Cache task. If you’re building Angular applications with Azure DevOps, you will be running npm install command every time even if you’re not changed anything in the package.json. It is a time consuming process. Azure Devops offers a Cache task, which will help you to cache downloaded libraries or tools your build pipeline. In this example, I am using a minimal angular application, which is added to Azure Repo - you can use GitHub or any other source control supported by Azure DevOps. And then I created a build pipeline for the Angular application.
item.author: (Anuraj)

item.title: Welcoming the Slovak Republic Government to Have I Been Pwned
item.description: Today I'm very happy to welcome the 23rd national government to Have I Been Pwned, the Slovak Republic. As of now, CSIRT.sk has full and free access to query all their government domains via an API that returns all their email addresses impacted by each data breach in HIBP.

item.title: The initializing constructor looks like an assignment, but it isn't

I gave as an example this class: class Buffer { public: Buffer(size_t capacity);
